title: Tamil Nadu
description: The state Tamil Nadu is the 11th largest state in the 29 states of India. The word Tamil Nadu means 'The Land of Tamils or Tamil Country'. This state has huge amount of natural resources. It also boasts some of the grand Hindu temples built in Dravidian architecture. Some of the monuments in Mamallapuram here is also declared as UNESCO Heritage Sites. Tamil Nadu has an abundant source of Flora and Fauna. It has also been home to the oldest of civilizations, and has seen the rule of various ancient dynasties like the Chera, Chola and Pandya, thus making it rich in both aspects of Cultural and Natural making it a tourist heaven.

title: Uttar Pradesh
description: Uttar Pradesh is also known as the Heartland of India. It is rich in cultural heritage and offers great scenic views. You can explore both nature and history here. Surrounded by the ranges of the famous Ganga and the Yamuna, it showcases few of the best man made monuments. Back in limelight a few days ago owing to the Bhoomi Poojan ceremony of the Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, it is going to be one of the biggest draws for pilgrims, adding a feather in the hat of Uttar Pradesh tourism.

title: Himachal Pradesh
description: Himachal Pradesh is among the most visited part of the northern India. The scenaric beauty of Himalayas is a treat to the eye for all the naturelovers and a must visit for truly a lifetime experience. It is covered with mountains and offers you some exciting activities like river rafting, camping, paragliding and so much more. The places there offers you everything right from local handicrafts and specialised food to a wonderful view and lots of memories. It is truly a heaven on Earth. Here's our pick of the top places while you are in the region.
